choiceresponse.label: Which of the following are fruits?
choiceresponse.description: Select all that apply. There may be more than one correct answer.

checkboxgroup.choice:
Apple
Yes, an apple is a fruit. U: Don't you know that an apple is a fruit?

Potato
A potato is not fleshy or seed based. U: A pototo is not fleshy or seed based.

Broccoli
Broccoli is good for you, but not a fruit U: Not a fruit, but you should eat more broccoli.

Banana
Correct, a banana is a fruit. U: Perhaps if you ate more fruits, you would know that a banana is one of them!
checkboxgroup.compoundhint: You clearly understand the difference between a fruit and a vegetable. Great job!

div.p: In common language usage, "fruit" normally means the fleshy seed-associated structures of a plant that are sweet or sour, and edible in the raw state, such as apples, bananas, grapes, lemons, oranges, and strawberries. On the other hand, in botanical usage, "fruit" includes many structures that are not commonly called "fruits", such as bean pods, corn kernels, tomatoes, and wheat grains.
